entry.title: EWM: How is the Quantity field of an HU derived?
entry.content:
Hi, experts!

i'm an ABAP technical trying to learn EWM for my requirement.
Would anyone know how the quantity field of a Handling Unit is derived?

For context, I need to query the quantity of a given HU ID for my program.
My test data HU ID, 300002517, has a quantity 100 in detail view (Work Center) via /SCWM/MON (Warehouse Monitor). I was wondering where this 100 came from.
In table /SCWM/GMHUITM (Handling Unit Item) there is a quantity field but this GU ID does not exist. In table /SCWM/HUHDR, this HU 300002517 has a phystat (internal status) of 'A' (Notified/Planned) so perhaps this is a factor why there's no value in /SCWM/GMHUITM for this HU. 
I checked the material/batch/plant in t-code MMBE, I did not find any quantity/stock. 
Could there be a t-code (standard) which will show me this 100 qty value given my HU? Thanks in advance! (i attach the quantity screenshot)

entry.title: SAP Business Data Cloud and AI: Telling the story to drive adoption
entry.content:
Data conversations are changing.  Fast.  And many customers are still stuck in the middle ‚Äî plenty of data, not enough trust, context, or impact.

That‚Äôs exactly why we‚Äôre hosting ‚ÄúSAP Business Data Cloud and AI: Telling the story to drive adoption.‚Äù  This session is designed for SAP Partners who want to confidently connect real customer pain points to SAP‚Äôs vision for Cloud ERP, Finance Intelligence, and AI.

We‚Äôll walk through why data trust breaks down, what SAP Business Data Cloud (SAP BDC) changes with its business data fabric, and how partners can turn this into tangible services and repeatable wins. Honestly, the goal is simple: help you tell a clearer, more compelling story ‚Äî backed by architecture, demos, and real partner plays.

You‚Äôll see how SAP Databricks fits natively into SAP BDC with zero-copy delta sharing, how AI-infused insights come to life, and how to move customers from assessment to scale without friction.

If you‚Äôre shaping customer narratives, designing solutions, or leading engagements ‚Äî this one‚Äôs for you.  üëâ Register now https://partneredge.sap.com/en/library/education/psd/2026/jan/e_oe_te_w_PSD_WEB_00012794.html

#SAP #SAPBTP #SAPPartners #SAPBusinessDataCloud #SAPAI #CloudERP #FinanceTransformation

entry.title: Error E2023 when changing the table of a projection view via SE11
entry.content:
In my system ABAP 7.58 SP 1, I've created and activated a projection view via SE11, then I want to change the base table to ZXXXX and got the error E2023 "ZXXXX is not active" although the table ZXXXX is active?

I couldn't find a SAP note for that. What's the problem, how to fix it?

Thanks.

Sandra

entry.title: Re: Error E2023 when changing the table of a projection view via SE11
entry.content:
There's a fix by the SAP note 3558664 - Creation of projection view not possible with SE11 - SAP for Me.

For information, it's mentioned that the bug happens only for the creation, but it happens for the modification too. Also, the SAP note mentions the error text but not its message number E2023.

entry.title: Creating value in airlines
entry.content:
MOST PROFITABLE, LARGEST, AND MOST VALUABLE ARILINE

As we travel back from the holidays, or into year-start meetings, it may be a good time to reflect on the companies that make such travel possible. In this case, let‚Äôs examine Delta Air Lines‚Äô transformation journey with SAP.

Specifically, let us zoom in on three related areas of transformation:
1. Delta‚Äôs strategy of top customer experience, which among other things means on-time flights.
2. Workforce optimization to enable upward mobility for some 100,000 people.
3. Improving financial close, which was historically burdened with significant non-linearity.

These areas of Delta‚Äôs evolution show a clear connection between passenger experience, Delta‚Äôs own resources, and share- and debt-holders as providers of capital.

Let‚Äôs start from the customer excellence.
‚ÄÉ
ON-TIME ARRIVAL
You can see the comparison of Delta with other major global airlines: horizontally plotted are percentages of flights with on-time arrival and vertically plotted are the number of flights per year. Delta, with some of the highest number of flights in the world, is constantly improving its on-time arrival statistics and currently stands at 84%. This is an amazing achievement for such a large operation. The accolades from the media and experts are well deserved.

But let‚Äôs look at what it took to achieve such operational excellence.

For now, let us focus on the processes part of the equation; we will talk about people soon.
The major reason for delayed flights, apart from the weather, is supplies. Catering, to be more specific. Before Delta embarked on the journey to significantly overhaul its operations, the state of the union was as follows:

  1. Very large operations across the globe‚Ä¶ but email communications with the suppliers.
  2. Multiple items of supplies‚Ä¶ but some not even recorded in Delta‚Äôs inventory system. For example, there were stories of half a million dollars' worth of earbuds and a million dollars' worth of blankets left in various airports without any visibility for Delta‚Äôs operational colleagues.

That had to change, and Delta did change them. To support its in-sourcing processes, the company adopted SAP IBP and SAP SAC to enable some 155 locations, 255 suppliers and 8 warehouses worldwide.
As a result of demand sensing and inventory optimization, Delta was able to optimize its catering, including the weight aspect of the supplies (for example, the number of food and beverage items based on the passenger count). This, in turn, led do significant fuel savings, which cumulatively accounted for some $100m cost savings in 2024.

To sum it up, for the first strategic transformation area, not only did Delta improve its on-time arrival KPI but it also removed some costs. This brings us to the people side of the equation‚Ä¶

Workforce mobility
Operational excellence goes hand in hand with the people excellence. Especially when you know that people expenses account for a quarter of your revenue or some $15 billion, and they grow faster than revenues.
The company decided to do a few things:
1. Lower the educational requirements and rather train people on the job.
2. Give people opportunities to advance.
3. Lower the ‚Äúextra shift costs‚Äù where possible.

Why this was critical becomes clear when you look at Delta‚Äôs workforce‚Ä¶
Delta‚Äôs people represent a very diverse human resource organization, by location, type of job performed, and typical challenges.

So let us, together with Delta, look at one typical employee‚Ä¶
Like many large organizations, Delta sees two significant workforce drivers: Source & Recruit and Enable & Develop.
It‚Äôs the second one where the company realized it was missing a lot. Meet Eleanor, a typical high-achiever, who ‚Äì through her effort on the ground ‚Äì became a top performer (‚Äúred coat‚Äù in Delta‚Äôs language) but wants to push herself even higher. When Eleanor searched the corporate portal for job opportunities in Finance, some 1,100 results appeared ‚Äì an impossible number to comprehend and take action on. This is what Delta‚Äôs colleagues call the ‚Äúfoggy gap‚Äù: the desire to learn and grow is present, but no enabler exists for that.

When the managers considered the traditional approach, they quickly realized its limitations and resulting frustration, both for the employees and for the hiring managers.

Therefore, Delta adopted its own, unique approach: FOCUS ON SKILLS, NOT JOB DESCRIPTION.

During the transformation, Delta created a repository of SKILLS making it available to employee and tying skills the Delta‚Äôs HR needs. This enables the employees to focus on what they either have to have to develop, as opposed to searching through numerous job postings and trying to decipher them.  The results of this approach are quite telling.  Half of the managerial positions are filled with experience Delta veterans ensuring upward mobility and job satisfaction, and the central skills repository is easy to maintain and update.

But most important is the overall outcome: employees who feel taken care of by Delta, take good care of the Delta customers.

Now that we have reviewed two strategic initiatives ‚Äì on time flight arrival and employee mobility ‚Äì we can look at another challenge Delta faced throughout the years.

 

Nonlinearity
It is January 1. Or April1. Time to close the year or quarter. Yet during this first week of January or April, Delta receives the vast majority of its invoices including from contractors for the previous period. The week is literally flooded with work. For the year close, we are talking about some $30 billion in gross debits! That‚Äôs half of the total annual business.

Such contracted services come from different sources, including companies such as Unifi, an approximately $2bn and 40,000 employee strong largest provider of air services in North America. (link)

Services such as plane taxying, cleaning, baggage loading, special needs passenger transportation, tie back to the on-time flight departure and arrival as well, so they are critical to Delta‚Äôs strategy...
‚Ä¶and for Delta, such services spell into some $4 billion cost item, i.e., approximately $1bn each quarter.

Before the transformation, most of such reconciliation and postings were manual. To automate this process, Delta utilized SAP HANA as the main source of flight data, coupled it with the AI tools from Blackline, creating a more automatic incoming invoice matching and posting process.

As a result, some 2/3 ds of the accruals became automatic matches, and that trend continues. Overall, this automation significantly lessens the strain of period close and compresses the time to close, freeing oCFO colleagues‚Äô time for higher added value work.

But the amazing by-product of the automation is a much shorter time to publish quarterly reports. Among the major US airlines, Delta is the fastest to file its 10-Qs, the quarterly reports, therefore improving its stance with the share- and debt-holders.

So, the question is, does the market notice all these Delta‚Äôs efforts to evolve across the three strategic imperatives?

Recap
The answer is unequivocal yes. Through its incredible journey to improve customer service, create workforce mobility, and combat non-linearity for faster financial close, in the past 5 years, Delta grew its Enterprise Value by 1.4x or at approximately 7.6% CAGR. Delta has become one of the most profitable and the most valuable airline.  I am proud to say that SAP has supported Delta in every step.


*    *     *

Big debt of gratitude to my partners at SAP and, most importantly, to Delta ‚Äì for being an SAP customer!

entry.title: Re: Tree-Table Support in CAP is Now Generally Available
entry.content:
@Birgir 

I am currently using a Tree Table macro for hierarchical representation of data.

The entity data is not persistent; it is an aggregation of standard SAP APIs.

I have implemented a custom read handler in cap java to aggregate the data, and the resulting entity is passed to the Tree Table macro.

Custom handler is setting the result of list of entity to context.

When the data is requested, an error is thrown stating that the count is missing for the query

Could you please guide me to solve the issue?

Thanks & Regards,

Anita

entry.title: Scripting SAC with DropDown
entry.content:
Hi team,

I‚Äôm facing an issue while creating a form in SAP Analytics Cloud and I‚Äôd appreciate your help.

I have a table and a form.
When I select a row in the table and click a button, I retrieve the selected member and populate several input fields and a dropdown based on the member‚Äôs properties.

The InputFields are filled correctly, but the Dropdown isn't.
The value returned from the member property is not assigned to the dropdown, even though it is not empty.

In the final screenshot, I‚Äôve added a visual explanation of the issue to make it clearer.

Snipped 1 ‚Äì Populating the dropdown

Snipped 2 ‚Äì Selecting a row in the table, clicking the button, and opening a popup that displays the data from the selected row

Here is the code I‚Äôm using:

 

Snipped 1:

Dropdown_31.removeAllItems(); // limpar o dropdown
 
var l_arr11= ArrayUtils.create(Type.string); // array de valores √∫nicos
var allMembers5_$ = PlanningModel_1.getMembers("CP_DI_Projeto_PD", { limit: 1000 });
 
for (var a = 0; a < allMembers5_$.length; a++) {
    var tipo_projeto =allMembers5_$[a].properties["Tipo_Projeto"];
 
     var id20 = allMembers5_$[a].id;
    if (id20.startsWith("Dummy")) {
        continue;
    }
    // Verifica se o valor existe e ainda n√£o foi adicionado
    if (tipo_projeto !== undefined && l_arr11.indexOf(tipo_projeto) === -1) {
console.log(tipo_projeto);
        l_arr11.push(tipo_projeto);
        Dropdown_31.addItem(tipo_projeto);
    }
}

Snipped 2:

 

var selections = Table_4.getSelections();
 
if (selections.length === 0) {
    return;
}
 
var sel = selections[0];
 
var selMeasure = sel[Alias.MeasureDimension];
 
if (selMeasure === undefined) {
 
    var dim = Table_4.getDimensionsOnRows()[0];
    var ds = Table_4.getDataSource();
 
    var member1 = ds.getResultMember(dim, sel);
console.log(member1);
 
    if (member1) {
        var descricao = member1.description;
        var tipoProjeto = member1.properties["CP_DI_Projeto_PD.Tipo_Projeto"];
var Datainicio = member1.properties["CP_DI_Projeto_PD.DataInicio"];
var DataFim = member1.properties["CP_DI_Projeto_PD.DataFim"];
 
        console.log(descricao);
        console.log(tipoProjeto);
 
 
        InputField_23.setValue(descricao);
InputField_25.setValue(Datainicio);
InputField_24.setValue(DataFim);
        Dropdown_29.setSelectedKey(tipoProjeto);
 
    }
}


 


Thank you,

Ganjos

entry.title: What's New in SAP BTP - Q4 2025 Innobytes
entry.content:
Happy new year and welcome back to the SAP BTP Innobytes! 2026 is going to be an exciting year and we have big ideas and a strong strategy for the year ahead! In the meantime, let‚Äôs see how we finished out last year with some innovative highlights.

Check out the video below and explore the latest features in Application Development, Integration and more. Enjoy watching!

 

 

Data & Analytics

My Metrics

To keep up with the important numbers and data, let me introduce you to your personalized watchlist to keep up with what really matters: My Metrics in SAP Analytics Cloud on SAP BTP.

You can find it via the My Metrics Card on the new Homepage, bringing together performance cards from stories and models into one easy-to-access space with these core areas:

  • Your Metrics to manage cards
  • Detailed Visualization with instant charts and active filters
  • Smart Insights surfacing automated observations

You can create lists from My Metrics page or directly from a story chart: select a data point that you want to track and add it to an existing list or create a new one. You can name the metric and customize suggested comparisons and default visualizations. It‚Äôs now possible to rename, delete, copy or move metrics between different lists. You can Share multiple metrics with tailored permissions and distribute it with different SAC users or teams. 

See these steps in action (starting at 0:09).

Learn more

  • MyMetrics Blog Post

 

App Dev Highlights

Analytical Table with RAP and SAP Fiori

Real-time data analysis tools are essential for decision-making, that‚Äôs why SAP BTP ABAB introduced these powerful features for business users.

By adding the annotation @odata.applySupportedForAggregation: #FULL to your data model, you can now unlock advanced aggregation, grouping, and subtotalling directly in Fiori analytical tables. View real-time summarized business data, group by key fields, and dynamically sort and analyse profitability. This way you can simplify analytics for end users, enabling faster, data-driven decisions.

Watch the demo starting at 1:37 to get more insights.

Learn more

  • Developing Read-Only RAP Analytical Tables

 

SAP Build Extensibility Wizard now available in SAP SuccessFactors

You might already know the SAP Build Extensibility Wizard, supporting developers in process creation and UI extensions directly from Cloud ERP apps. This feature is now also available in SAP SuccessFactors.

In this example we want to simplify the process of requesting personal data from new hires in the onboarding process:

  1. Launch the process variant manager from the SAP SuccessFactors application and select the specific HR process you want to extend.
  2. To let the new hire know, that their data has been accepted, we want to add a step of approval. The wizard will walk you through the familiar steps to set up our extension.
  3. You can jump directly into SAP Build to customize this process.
  4. View the process from the SAP SuccessFactors application, reviewing the new hires and the personal data they have collected.
  5. HR will get a notification in the Task Center Inbox and can select approve, notifying the new hire.

The Extensibility wizard can now practice its magic in SAP SuccessFactors, delivering a better experience for our employees with SAP Build.

To watch this innovation example, start the video at 2:41.

Learn more

  • Extensibility Support
  • Understanding Extensibility
  • Extension types

 

Joule Studio Agent Builder

When it comes to making decisions for your business, transparency and control are essential. AI agents can help speed up the process but building AI agents that are both powerful and enterprise-ready is a challenge. How do you combine development speed with the governance and trust your business demands? 

Describe your business goals to your AI conversational Partner and let Joule build an agent that fits your needs. It automatically discovers tools and connects to external systems through the framework support for MCP. Giving the agent deep business context enables smarter decision-making. The timeline feature gives you full transparency, showing every step of the agent's logic, essential for debugging and governance. 

Start the demo at 4:21 to learn all about the Agent Builder in Joule Studio.

Learn more

  • Joule Studio Learning Series (Blog Post)
  • SAP Learning: Building your first Joule Skill
  • Joule Studio

 

Integration

Local OData API access & SAP HANA support in Edge Integration Cell

When it comes to manage persistence and monitoring in hybrid landscapes, integration is an essential step to make it more flexible.

Edge Integration Cell now supports SAP HANA as both a database and datastore, offering an alternative to PostgreSQL and Redis. If your landscape already runs on HANA, avoid maintaining separate persistence systems by unifying your data layer. One SAP HANA instance can be used for multiple Edge to keep everything consistent and centralized. To ensure the reliability of your integrations even if the cloud connection isn‚Äôt available, try the Local OData API access for your Edge runtime. You can retrieve message processing logs, data stores, and other runtime info through local GET APIs.

To use the Local API Access,

  • Activate the API Plan support to the cluster using the ELMO UI
  • Modify the configuration by adding a valid API Virtual Host and an API Virtual Host Key Alias

These settings are also available upon onboarding a new Edge node, allowing a stronger performance and visibility into your integrations. 

Watch this part (starting at 5:36) to get more insights.

Learn more

  • SAP Integration Suite
  • Local OData API Access in Edge Integration Cell Runtimes

 

Security

SAP Key Management Service

SAP Key Management Service (KMS) enables customers to manage encryption keys to business compliance and regulations. Group systems and keys in key configurations according to your requirements.   

The Primary Key is the active one for encryption. The SAP KMS supports Hold Your Own Key (HYOK) and Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) by importing Your Key. Revoke a key at any time by disabling or deleting it, leading to a shutdown of the connected systems, locking the data. When assigned to a KMS tenant, connect the system seamless via the UI. The four-eye-principle secures tasks like connecting a system or a key action.

To see this demo in action, watch the video (starting at 7:04).

 

Share your thoughts 

These videos are for YOU, and we would love to hear your impressions. How do you like the video? How can we improve the upcoming videos? Please share your feedback by liking this post or leaving a comment below.

Thank you for your support and happy viewing, sharing, and enjoying!

You Might Also Be Interested In

  • SAP BTP Garage: monthly LIVE webinar with hands-on use case walkthroughs and demos.
  • Unlocking SAP BTP: monthly podcast covering all things SAP BTP.

entry.title: Fiori Elements List Report OData V4: Custom Filter for Custom Column Based on Associated Entity 1..*
entry.content:
Hello Fiori experts,

I am working on a Fiori Elements List Report application based on an OData V4 service and I have a question regarding the correct integration of a custom filter into the FilterBar.

Initial Situation

  • Fiori Elements List Report

  • OData V4 service

  • Table and FilterBar are generated automatically by Fiori Elements

  • No replacement of standard controls, only extensions

Custom Column in the Table

I have successfully extended the table with a custom column (GLD Indicators).

  • The displayed data comes from an associated entity with cardinality 1..*

  • The values of this association are concatenated and shown as a string in the table column

  • I could not find a standard SAP way to achieve this requirement

  • The current solution works well for display purposes and is acceptable for my use case

Goal: Filtering This Custom Column

Now I want to filter this custom column.

Because the data comes from an associated entity (1..*), I could not find a standard annotation-based solution for filtering either.
Therefore, I decided to add a custom filter field to the FilterBar.

Custom Filter Implementation

  • The custom filter is added to the FilterBar via manifest.json using a fragment

  • Inside the fragment, I use a MultiComboBox

  • The value help for the custom filter:

    • is loaded in the onAfterRendering lifecycle

    • written into a JSONModel

    • and bound to the items aggregation of the MultiComboBox

  • On the Search event of the FilterBar:

    • I read all selected keys from the MultiComboBox

Up to this point, everything works as expected.

The Actual Problem

At this stage, I am stuck:

üëâ How can I add the selection from my custom filter to the table filters so that Fiori Elements sends the correct OData request?

  • The goal is that the filter selection is included in the $filter part of the request

  • The filter must be applied to an associated entity

  • The OData V4 service already supports this scenario correctly,
    this is an example request, showing what I am need, the request delivers my expected result set:

What I Have Tried So Far

  • Using ExtensionAPI.setFilterValues(...)

    • had no effect

Core Question

What is the recommended / official approach in Fiori Elements to:

  • integrate a custom filter field into a sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar

  • in combination with a custom table column

  • based on an associated entity (1..*)

  • so that Fiori Elements automatically generates the correct OData V4 request?

Alternatively:

  • Is there a supported extension point where custom filters can be added to the binding?

  • Or is this scenario generally only solvable via backend logic or annotations?

Thank you very much in advance for your support.

Best regards

Marius

entry.title: Your 2026 Roadmap to Getting Started with ABAP AI and ABAP-1
entry.content:
The era of "Wait and See" for AI in ABAP development is officially over. With the general availability of Joule for Developers (J4D) and the planned availability of ABAP agentic AI frameworks in 2026,  the question isn't if you should use AI, but where you should start. 

The "Start Here" Recommendation:  For 90% of developers, the best starting point is SAP Joule for Developers integrated within ABAP Development Tools (ADT) for Eclipse. In addition you can also experiment with the first versions of ABAP-1 model to analyze and explain code on your own - but be aware that this is currently not for code generation and only for those which want to be independent of J4D. Therefore starting with J4D is the fastest but also the most powerful way to start with ABAP AI.

 
Why should I start with Joule for Developers (J4D)?
  • Contextual Intelligence: Unlike generic LLMs, Joule for Developers is trained on over 250 million lines of proprietary SAP code and is aware of your specific ABAP Cloud context.
  • It‚Äôs Free (For Now): SAP has extended the free promotional period for Joule for Developers until September 2026.
  • Native Skills: It handles predictive code generation (e.g. RAP generation), "Explain" skills for legacy code, and unit test generation directly within your IDE. So it can do way more then ABAP-1 right now.
  • J4D is out of the box integrated in Eclipse ADT.
The Three Paths for ABAP AI Evolution:
1. The Standard Path: Joule for Developers in ADT
  • Best for: Daily coding, documentation, and unit testing.
  • Action: Request access through your administrator (Material #8019124) and activate it in ADT.
2. The Innovation Path: ABAP AI SDK & BTP Free Tier
  • Best for: Building your own AI-powered business applications (e.g., automated invoice processing).
  • Action: Use the SAP BTP Free Tier to access the Generative AI Hub and the ABAP AI SDK to connect your custom ABAP code to external foundation models.
3. The Modernization Path: VS Code with ABAP Cloud
  • Best for: Developers looking for a lightweight, file-based experience or those migrating to S/4HANA Public Cloud.
  • Action: Explore the new ABAP Cloud Extension for VS Code (GA planned for Q2 2026) which features built-in AI assistance powered by an ABAP language server.
Key Takeaway for 2026:
Don't get bogged down trying to "prompt engineer" experimental models like ABAP-1 for production code generation. Instead, leverage Joule for Developers mature "Explain" and "Generate" skills to maintain a Clean Core and accelerate your migration to SAP S/4HANA.

Here you can learn more:

  1. SAP Joule for Developers Expands to Private Cloud: Accelerating ABAP Innovation and Transformation

  2. Step-by-step guide how to activate SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities for your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  3. Joule for Developers (J4D) Setup Guide
  4. SAP BTP Discovery Center (Free Tier Services)
  5. Joule for Developers help (J4D)
  6. ABAP AI SDK Documentation
  7. ABAP-1 Help

entry.title: New feature: How to enforce Multi‚ÄëFactor Authentication (MFA) by a Super User - SAP for Me
entry.content:
As a Super Admin, you have two options to enforce MFA, depending on your administrative needs.

Via User List Page

  1. The Customer Super Admin login to Sap for Me and opens the User ‚ÄÉManagement Tool.
  2. Navigates to the User List page.
  3. Searches, filters, and selects one or multiple users.
  4. Enforces Multi‚ÄëFactor Authentication (MFA) for the selected users.

Via User Details Page

  1. The Customer Super Admin opens a specific user from the User List.
  2. On the User Details page, enforces MFA for that user.

Once a Super Admin enforces Multi‚ÄëFactor Authentication (MFA) for a S-user, the system automatically sends an email notification to the affected user.

The notification:

  • Informs the user that MFA has been enforced by their company administrator
  • Explains why MFA is required
  • Provides clear instructions on the steps the user must take to complete MFA setup

This communication ensures that users are aware of the change in advance and understand the required actions before their next login.

Email notification to user.

Provides notification on MFA enablement and instructions on what steps the user has to take to set it up on their end.

‚ÄÉThe user is forced to set up MFA method on their next login.

Refer to SAP KBA:

https://me.sap.com/notes/3706192/E

Best wishes

Dragana

entry.title: Accessing Loading step for Outbound Delivery flow in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
We are working on S/4HANA Cloud Starter System (EWM ‚Äì Public Cloud).
Outbound delivery processing is available and preconfigured for Packing and Goods Issue.

However, we are facing an issue with the Loading step in the outbound flow.

Expected Process Flow:
OBD ‚Üí Picking ‚Üí Packing ‚Üí Loading ‚Üí Goods Issue
(Picking and Loading to be executed via RF Device)

Issue Observed:

  • Outbound Delivery is created and distributed to EWM successfully

  • Picking and Packing are available

  • Loading step is not triggered / not accessible

  • RF-based Loading is not determined

  • Goods Issue can be posted without explicit Loading


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Accessing Loading step for Outbound Delivery flow in...
entry.content:
• Please confirm whether Loading as a separate step is supported in EWM Public Cloud Starter System. -----Yes, but its only status changing, no WO/WT provided.
  • Please confirm whether RF-based Loading is supported in the Starter system or only in Development/3-System landscapes. -----Yes, but only for ASR. Non-ASR case is not supported, will display a message ‚ÄúCan't load goods for deliveries not relevant to Advanced SR. (/SCWM/RF_DE524)‚Äù.
  • Please advise if Loading is implicitly combined with Packing or Goods Issue in Public Cloud. -----No, it‚Äôs not combined with packing and goods issue.
  • If Loading is supported, please share the required configuration (SSCUI / settings) to enable:  -----For RF in cloud, should be ASR case with correct freight order and loading point be maintained.
    • Loading step
    • RF Loading execution
  • Use RF / Fiori to create manual warehouse tasks (WTs) for Handling Units (HUs): Yes, RF in Cloud WM supports this. Please refer to logic transaction ‚Äú05 Internal Processes -> 02 Adhoc WT creation‚Äù
  • Move picked HUs from storage bins to a dedicated ‚ÄúLoading‚Äù bin (custom bin, e.g. LOAD-AREA) :  Yes, RF in Cloud WM supports this. As my understanding this should be a picking process, by configuration it supports to pick HU from bin to load area.
  • Perform Goods Issue (GI) after all HUs are physically staged in the Loading bin:  No, RF doesn‚Äôt support GI. Need to do GI in Fiori App.

This would allow warehouse users to perform loading activities operationally (pick ‚Üí move ‚Üí stage ‚Üí GI) even though the ‚ÄúLoading by HU‚Äù option available in SAP GUI is not present in Public Cloud: I would like to clarify that the WO for picking could have 2 steps/WTs, first one move HU from source bin to resource. Second one move HU from source to loading area. The two steps belong to picking WO. For loading it‚Äôs just a status without WO/WT. When warehouse operator moved HU to the truck that means the loading is finished.

 

  1. Whether this RF-based manual WT approach is supported/recommended in Public Cloud: It‚Äôs same question with the first one in above. If so, answer is yes, RF supports to create WT manually. If customer is asking about a scenario or complete business solution for whole outbound processing. About how to use the provided functionality to support their business then this will be another question. I think customer need implementation consultant to support and design the business solution in their system. If the picking provided already satisfy customer‚Äôs requirement we recommend the standard picking but not use adhoc WT to replace standard picking. But if provided picking doesn‚Äôt satisfy customer‚Äôs requirement but adhoc WT creation did then that‚Äôs no problem.
  2. Any SAP-recommended best practices or restrictions for using a ‚ÄúLoading‚Äù bin concept without TM : Loading by RF in Cloud WM, only support ASR case. Loading without TM is not supported in RF in Cloud WM. But picking is supported. 
  3. If HU status change at the Loading bin is sufficient before GI in this scenario:  Sorry. This doesn‚Äôt seem like a question. But we are sure that picking is mandatory for GI. Loading is not mandatory for GI. Picking completed then GI can proceed.

entry.title: Re: Setting Up PostgreSQL for SAP BTP Development: A Practical Guide
entry.content: A tenant can be lightweight, maybe KBs of data, whereas a HC instance may contain up to 3000 tenants. You save max 3000 database instances. Same for HDI-Containers (but weaker isolation). The HC instance size starts with 16GB/1vCPU. The smaller the instance and the higher the number of tenants the more cost savings you have against multiple database instances. Sure, the workload must fit. I don't know the Postgres pricing in BTP exactly. I could guess that the break-even is reached with approx. 5 tenants in a single HC instance (smallest db size) vs 5 Postgres DB instances (smallest db size) in AWS.  You can try it out comparing HC instance https://hcsizingestimator.cfapps.eu10.hana.ondemand.com/sap/hana/estimator/index.html  and BTP Postgres https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/viewServices

entry.title: RAP Fiori Elements List Report Page with Analytical Table - How to?
entry.content:
Hi community,

I‚Äôm currently trying to implement a Fiori Elements List Report based on RAP and OData V4 and I‚Äôm struggling to align the current technical limitations with what is announced on the SAP roadmap.

My requirement

I need a generated Fiori Elements application that provides:

  • a List Report
    • using an Analytical Table
    • showing totals and subtotals for measures (amounts / quantities with currency or unit)
    • while still allowing create / update operations on the underlying business data via RAP

In other words:
üëâAggregations (totals/subtotals) and editability in the same List Page.

Roadmap reference

According to the SAP Roadmap (Q3 2025):

Support for analytical tables
Use analytical tables to provide users with totals and subtotals in applications
Feature is delivered as described in the documentation: Tables ‚Äì SAPUI5 SDK

Based on this roadmap entry, I would assume that using an AnalyticalTable in a Fiori Elements List Report is now intended to be a supported and productive option.

What I experience in practice

  • When using a transactional RAP BO (provider contract transactional_query) as the data source:
    • editing works as expected
    • but configuring the table as AnalyticalTable leads to aggregation-related errors
      (e.g. ‚ÄúAggregation not supported for this entity type‚Äù or
      ‚ÄúProperty ‚ÄòCurrency‚Äô is not flagged as custom aggregate‚Äù)
    • When switching to an analytical query view (@analytics.query: trueüòû
      • totals and subtotals work
      • but the entity becomes read-only, so editing is no longer possible
    • The Annotations @odata.applySupportedForAggregation: #FULL
      (mentioned in this scenario) is not permitted in RAP CDS view entities.

My open questions

  1. With the roadmap item marked as delivered:
    1. is it now officially supported to use an Analytical Table in a Fiori Elements List Report on top of a transactional RAP BO?
  2. If yes: what is the recommended architecture?
    1. a single transactional RAP BO with analytical capabilities?

    2. or still a separation between analytical (read-only) and transactional entities?

  3. If not: does the roadmap item only refer to UI5 analytical tables in general, but not to RAP-based, editable Fiori Elements List Reports yet?

Any clarification on the intended usage and current limitations would be highly appreciated.

Thanks a lot in advance and best regards;
Sarah

entry.title: Re: Cannot change Revenue Recognition Key to SPFCSC for C...
entry.content:
Revenue recognition key SPFCSC:
The revenue recognition key works like the SPFC key, but it has a different handling with the status Completed.
Let‚Äôs say that a project runs from April 1 to May 31. On June 6, the project is set to Completed. Until project completion, all postings are identical to the SPFC postings. However, by using the revenue recognition key SPFC, the clearing postings would occur in the revenue recognition run in June as this is the month when the project was set to Completed. Using the key SPFCSC, the clearing postings occur in the revenue recognition run in May as this is the month where the project ends, independent of the project status.

Answer to your questions:

  1. Revenue recognition key can be changed anytime during these stages of project/contract  (Project has status ‚Äúin process‚Äù, and  Contract‚Äôs item has status ‚ÄúReleased‚Äù ). It is recommended to re-run revenue recognition period end closing run. This run will recalculate revenue on the object based on new revenue recognition key.
    Revenue recognition keys can be change in these EBRR monitor apps:
    - Event-Based Revenue Recognition - Service Documents (F6007)
    - Event-Based Revenue Recognition ‚Äì Projects (F4767
  2. It is supported to change revenue recognition key on ongoing project, but revenue recognition keys have to be compatible. This means that both keys are from same revenue recognition rule (e.g. COSTPOC) or they can be from different recognition rule in case that they have same definition of usage/GL account pairs. For your case:  keys SPFC and SPFCSC are compatible ( belongs to same assignment rule - COSTPOC).
  3. Key SPFCCM is pre-delivered as ‚ÄúHidden‚Äù in EBRR customizing. This means it is not offered in value/search help. You can set this key as visible in below SSCUI.
    • Open App: "Manage your solution" -> Configure your solution
    • Filter: Application area: Finance, Sub Application area: Profitability analysis
    • Select Item: Revenue recognition
    • Select step. 1 :Maintain Settings for Event-Based Revenue Recognition (SSCUI ID 102530)
    • Select Node ‚ÄúRecognition Keys‚Äù 
    • Change ‚ÄúVisibility‚Äù for key SPFCSC to ‚ÄúShow‚Äù

Best Regards,
Jiri Minar
EBRR

"

System error occurred while generating settlement information

Message no. KD573

Diagnosis

An error occurred while the system was generating the AUAI table with the capitalization values for the CO line items.

System Response

Processing stopped.

Procedure

last year August, 2025 you have been informed about SAP UID Migration Project:  https://community.sap.com/t5/blog-posts-about-sap-websites/dive-into-the-future-of-sap-universal-id-and-understand-the-changes/ba-p/14187845

As of this week, the account migration has been successfully completed. S‚Äëusers were previously informed and requested to actively migrate their accounts as part of this process.

For users who did not complete the migration by the deadline, SAP performed the migration automatically. In these cases, the existing UID password was transferred to the corresponding S‚ÄëUser account, ensuring continued access without requiring any prior action from the user.

entry.title: Re: Setting Up PostgreSQL for SAP BTP Development: A Practical Guide
entry.content:
@Mark_TeichmannFair point. Did some rough estimations.

PostgreSQL Hyperscaler runs ~77 EUR/month minimal (2GB RAM, 1vCPU, 5GB).
HANA Cloud smallest (32GB, 2vCPU, 120GB) is ~632 EUR/month per CU estimator.

Break-even: around 8 apps. Below that, separate PostgreSQL wins. Above that, HANA with HDI containers or DB tenants is cheaper.

But.. all containers share the same compute pool. Fine for light CRUD, but one heavy query affects everyone. Plus, ideally each dev needs their own container - you need to count extra HDI for development.

the required role is: SAP_BR_EMPLOYEE, which you can find and assign in the Maintain Business Roles app, next inside this role go to Business Catalogs and add catalog: SAP_BW_BC_AQB_PC and SAP_CORE_BC_EXT_AQA_PC, save and refresh SAP

Both must be assigned together due to functional dependencies.

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Missing Legally Required Company Address Fields for E Invoicing: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud ‚Üî External
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I‚Äôm currently working on an e‚Äëinvoicing integration between SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and an external Peppol‚Äëcompliant e‚Äëinvoicing platform for Belgium.
During the design of the outbound invoice interface, we ran into a challenge regarding the retrieval of mandatory seller address information required for Belgian e‚Äëinvoicing.

Issue

Belgian e‚Äëinvoicing regulations require the invoice to include the seller‚Äôs registered address (street, number, postal code, city, country, etc.).
This data should be sourced from the Company Code issuing the billing document.

However, in S/4HANA Public Cloud, we have observed the following:

  • The Billing Document APIs (e.g., API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV) do not expose the selling company‚Äôs address.
  • The Company Code API (e.g., API_COMPANYCODE_SRV) does not provide address fields.
  • We identified the Manage Location API (API_LOCATION_SRV), which does contain address‚Äërelevant information ‚Äî but it is not available for our tenant because the required scope items are not activated, and they cannot be activated at this stage.
  • We have not found any alternative released API or CDS view providing Company Code address data.

Impact

Because these fields are missing from all accessible APIs, we cannot populate the legally required seller information in the payload sent to the e‚Äëinvoicing platform. This prevents successful validation of outbound invoices within the Belgian Peppol framework.

Questions for the Community

  1. Where can we retrieve the official Company Code / legal entity address in S/4HANA Public Cloud without relying on the Location API?
  2. What is SAP‚Äôs recommended approach for extracting mandatory seller information for e‚Äëinvoicing integrations?
  3. Has anyone implementing Belgian e‚Äëinvoicing in Public Cloud found a standard or alternative solution to this gap?

Environment

  • SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
  • Outbound billing via OData APIs
  • E‚Äëinvoicing via Peppol
  • Country: Belgium

Any insights, experience, or recommended design patterns would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: Re: SAP Business Data Cloud landscape (Q/Prod)
entry.content:
SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) can be set up either as separate instances for Quality and Production (BDC-Q and BDC-PROD) or as a single BDC instance with multiple tenants for Datasphere (DSP) and SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC). The right choice depends on priorities around isolation, cost, compliance, and operational complexity.

Separate Instances:

Full physical separation of environments
Higher licensing and infrastructure costs
Independent scaling, maintenance, and backups
Strongest isolation and compliance posture
More operational overhead and risk of configuration drift

Single Multi-Tenant Instance:

Logical separation via tenants (DSP-Q, DSP-PROD, SAC-Q, SAC-PROD)
Lower cost through shared resources and optimized capacity
Centralized maintenance and monitoring
Simplified operations and governance
Potential risks from shared resource contention or unified failure points

Integration & Operations

Separate instances provide complete isolation for DSP and SAC integrations and testing.
A multi-tenant setup offers tenant-level data isolation, shared compute/storage, unified identity management, and streamlined deployment pipelines.

Cost & Risk

Separate instances incur higher licensing, infrastructure, and support costs but minimize cross-environment risks.
Multi-tenant setups reduce costs and administrative burden but require strong governance to mitigate shared-resource and data-exposure risks.

Best Practices & Recommendations

Large or highly regulated enterprises often prefer separate instances for strict isolation and compliance.
Organizations focused on cost optimization and operational simplicity typically favor a single multi-tenant BDC.

Decision Guidance

Choose separate instances for strict compliance, independent scaling, and maximum isolation.
Choose single multi-tenant for cost efficiency, simplified operations, and when logical separation is sufficient.

What to think?

Perform a cost-benefit analysis
Review compliance and security requirements
Validate the target architecture with SAP support

Overall, multi-tenancy is cost-effective and operationally simpler, while separate instances offer stronger isolation and compliance assurance.

entry.title: mdk mobile service app no longer working after SAP note 3566727
entry.content:
Hello everyone, i am facing a very urgent issue.

after SAP note 3566727 - Remplacement du certificat racine dans SAP BTP, environnement Cloud Foundry, MDK apps no longer working on android 13 and under devices. Our app works on zebra devices that have android 13 and they cant start anymore.

We are getting: javax.net.ssl.error:SSLHandshakeException : java.security.cert.certPathValidatiorException.

We opened a sap ticket and recieved a pdf file with this:

Resolution
Upgrade the older device to Android 14 or higher
OR
Following google doc:
https://developer.android.com/privacy-and-security/security-config#CustomTrust
, another way does not need to install the certificate into device, and steps are as below.
1. access the cockpit of cf mobile service, download certificate from web browser.
2. without installing this certificate into device, just add certificate into client app, such as res/raw
3. add network_security_config.xml into res/xml, then apply it in AndroidManifest.xml file.
network_security_config.xml
<network-security-config>
<base-config>
<trust-anchors>
<certificates src="system"/>
<certificates src="@raw/trusted_roots"/>
</trust-anchors>
</base-config>
</network-security-config>
AndroidManifest.xml
<application
...
android:networkSecurityConfig="@xml/network_security_config">

We have a hybrid app developed in BTP devspace with js and cloud build, branded, but i dont have an AndroidManifest.xml in the branded zip or the workspace, nor can the client update the android devices. How can i do the above resolution?

Please advise.

RaulM

 

 

note:

i added android manifest in ...\App_Resources_Merge\Android\src\main\,  client certificate downloaded from mobileservices cockpit in App_Resources_Merge\Android\src\main\res\raw\ and network_security_config.xml in App_Resources_Merge\Android\src\main\res\xml\ with:  

network_security_config.xml:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<network-security-config>
<base-config>
<trust-anchors>
<certificates src="system"/>
<certificates src="@raw/nameofcertificate"/>
</trust-anchors>
</base-config>
</network-security-config> and 

AndroidManifest.xml:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<manifest xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android">

<application
android:networkSecurityConfig="@xml/network_security_config" />

</manifest> 

as in the pdf i got from SAP,  but still the same issue

entry.title: SAP Commerce Cloud and Consumer Industries 2025 Year in Review
entry.content:
2025 Year in Review: Continued Investment and Growth in SAP Commerce Cloud and Consumer Industries! 

It‚Äôs been an exciting year. SAP Commerce Cloud and the many products that support Consumer Industries rolled out‚ÄØmany cutting-edge capabilities, all designed to continuously deliver connected, trusted, and smooth commerce experiences that drive profitable growth for our customers. These include AI features, B2B Self-Service Portal, SAP Open Payment Framework, Search Service, SAP Customer Loyalty Management, and many more. In total, we delivered 171 new Commerce features and performance improvements across 65 releases, many of which were from customer requests. 

Now, let‚Äôs dive into the highlights! 

SAP Commerce Cloud named Leader in Gartner Magic Quadrant for Digital Commerce for 11th year in a row 

SAP has proudly been named a Leader in the‚ÄØ2025 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Digital Commerce. SAP remains the only vendor consistently recognized‚ÄØ11 times since 2014. 

SAP Commerce Cloud continues to empower organizations to drive growth and profitability. Key capabilities that distinguish SAP Commerce Cloud in digital commerce include: 

  • B2B Self-Service Portal with native ERP integration
  • Extensive enterprise reach
  • Support for complex business models

SAP Order Management Services Named Leader by IHL Group

SAP Order Management Services continued its strong market momentum, achieving a Leader position in The Order Management Market 2025 report by IHL Group. This recognition highlights the value of SAP Order Management delivers by streamlining operational complexity, delivering on customer promises, and enabling seamless omnichannel customer experience.  

IHL Group emphasized SAP Order Management Service's modular, composable architecture as well as native integration across the SAP ecosystem. The report also noted SAP Order Management Services' expanding AI capabilities as one of the key differentiators, empowering organizations for more intelligent order management processes. 

SAP Commerce Cloud - Cyber Week Results 

We had another‚ÄØhuge Cyber Week to kick off the biggest shopping season. SAP Commerce Cloud: 

  • Powered $17.8B in Gross Merchandise Value (GMV), a +40% year-over-year (YoY) increase
  • Peak per minute of $2.3B in GMV and 11K orders
  • We achieved these impressive results with 100% uptime! 

This is a testament to the support and rock-solid platform that helps our customers keep up with demand during the busiest time. 

And with the rise of agentic AI, read how ‚Äú2025 is the Last Year Online Shopping Starts with a Search Bar, Not a Sentence.‚Äù 

Expanding Retail and Fashion Capabilities with S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

We‚Äôve added many new capabilities to Retail, Fashion, and Vertical Business with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. The new features showcase our continued dedication to delivering innovative solutions and comprehensive end-to-end process coverage for retailers to stay competitive in the fast-paced environment. 

With features like order capturing in stores to handle hybrid scenarios and Mass Assignment of Products to Assortment modules, retailers save time with streamlined processes and reduce operational bottlenecks. 

For fashion retailers, value-added services charge codes can be added during order processing to increase the value of the product for the recipient and provide transparency on service-related items. 

We‚Äôve added localization to many more countries, including India, Australia, Mexico, Singapore, the UK, Belgium, Denmark, South Korea, and Chile, among others.‚ÄØThis brings our total to 44 countries. By addressing local tax, legal, and market-specific requirements, SAP S/4HANA Cloud ensures retailers worldwide can leverage its capabilities. 

By combining industry expertise, advanced functionality, and global compliance, SAP empowers retailers and fashion brands to stay ahead in an omnichannel, customer-centric world.  

Maximize Promotion Impact with SAP Revenue Growth Management 

SAP Revenue Growth Management had many new features to help customers turn every dollar of trade spend into measurable sales and margin growth: 

  • Faster Claims Processing ‚Äì Accelerate trade-promotion rebate settlements by matching deductions and invoices to planned promotions, validating claims, and creating credit memos in S/4HANA
  • AI-Powered Promotion Creation ‚Äì Assist creation of single promotions and generate multiple draft promotions quickly using natural language prompts and guided workflows 


Create Promotions with AI 

  • Flexible Units of Measure ‚Äì Plan and track promotions in multiple Units Of Measure, converting between trading units (TU), consumer units (CU), or normalized units (NU) for greater accuracy
  • Custom KPIs ‚Äì Configure new KPIs and rules beyond the 68 standard options for tailored analytics and reporting. Use throughout the application, use customer KPI‚Äôs in account KPI tracking aswell as dashboards & analytics.  


Custom KPI creation 

  • Configurable Fund Management ‚Äì Configure different fund types to further support control or trade spend with fund creation, budget adjustments, and spend tracking
  • Analytics Dashboards ‚Äì Access real-time insights and P&L analysis for individual promotions via embedded SAP Analytics Cloud
  • Custom Promotion Types ‚Äì Define scope, levels, and spend types to create promotion types beyond standard short- and long-term options
  • Account Plan Configuration ‚Äì Adapt account plans for different customer types, including baseline volume management and future indirect promotion planning. 


Account Plan Type configuration 

SAP Customer Loyalty Management: Stronger Connections for Business Growth

The recently launched SAP Customer Loyalty Management helps customers drive long-term relationship development and business growth.‚ÄØThe solution captures customer data and loyalty engagement in a cloud-based wallet that acts as a ‚Äúloyalty profile‚Äù, to better understand individual customer motivations and enhance segmentation and targeted marketing campaigns. 

The platform supports a wide range of loyalty models, all managed through a unified interface. Integration with SAP Cloud ERP Private and SAP Business Suite ensures visibility into loyalty-related financial metrics, helping organizations measure ROI and guide future investments. Marketing teams can track promotion performance, redemption rates, and liabilities, enabling them to scale loyalty strategies effectively within existing enterprise systems.


SAP Customer Loyalty Management 

AI Innovations Driving Commerce Forward 

Artificial Intelligence remains at the forefront of digital transformation‚Äîespecially with the rise of agentic AI. We‚Äôve introduced a range of new capabilities designed to make commerce smarter, faster, and more personalized. 

AI Shopping Agent 

Our enhanced Shopping Agent now goes beyond intent detection and natural language processing. It delivers tailored product recommendations directly on product pages and supports conversational actions like adding items to the cart or retrieving order details‚Äîorder number, date, shipping address, and total‚Äîwithout leaving the chat. 

Stock awareness is built in, giving merchants control over whether out-of-stock items appear in recommendations. This transparency reduces cart abandonment and improves customer confidence. For B2B scenarios, merchants can also enable bulk stock inquiries, ensuring buyers get accurate availability for large orders.  


AI Shopping Agent 

Catalog Optimization Agent 

This agent reviews product images and suggests improvements to boost discoverability and conversions. A human review step ensures quality before updates go live, reducing manual effort while maintaining brand integrity.  

Product Image Designer 

Easily refine visuals by removing unwanted objects, isolating products, or adjusting AI-generated images to meet brand standards. These enhancements help create compelling, accurate product imagery that drives engagement.  

Digital Service Agent  

Enhance the customer self-service experience and increase contact center efficiency by providing swift, informed support grounded in business knowledge from specific data sources to answer questions. Digital Service Agent addresses complex customer queries, seamlessly transitioning to human agents when needed. 

Digital Service Agent works with AI Shopping Agent, covering new use cases that deliver even more customer value. With both agents, customers benefit from unified support throughout their entire shopping journey, including assistance with post-sale requests.  


Digital Service Agent 

Joule Studio AI agent builder capability 

You can now create AI agents for SAP CX applications to retrieve information, complete tasks, and run autonomous actions using enterprise data from SAP Customer Experience and SAP Knowledge Graph. For example, a returns agent can be built to trigger returns execution based on insights and recommendation from the AI Agent on returns pending approval.

Joule Studio, part of SAP Build, provides developers with a comprehensive suite of low-code, no-code tools to easily extend Joule capabilities and orchestrate business workflows, including CX across SAP and non-SAP applications. Learn how to activate Joule Studio and start building, testing, and deploying AI Agents. 

B2B Self-Service Portal Empowers Customers with 24/7 Access 

Designed as an SAP Cloud ERP add-on, the SAP B2B Self-Service Portal offers post-purchase transparency without the complexity of a full commerce implementation. Launch in weeks using partner packages, then scale to SAP Commerce Cloud without data migration. Buyers gain real-time access to orders, delivery status, and invoices‚Äîreducing support overhead and improving satisfaction. 


B2B Self-Service Portal 

Reduce Payment Integration Complexity with Open Payment Framework 
Now extended for B2B transactions, this framework delivers secure, streamlined payment experiences with built-in validation, error handling, and feature toggles. Support for both account-based and digital payment options ensures flexibility‚Äîall managed centrally. 

Drive Conversions with Smarter Search Experiences

Helping customers find the right product quickly is key to boosting sales and improving satisfaction. Search Service is designed to deliver precision and flexibility, offering features that elevate product discovery: 

  • Customizable Indexing and Scoring ‚Äì Fine-tune search results to align with your business priorities
  • Intelligent Spell Correction & Suggestions ‚Äì Turn typos into successful searches with smart word recommendations
  • Variant Grouping ‚Äì Present related product variations together for a cleaner, more intuitive experience
  • Configurable Search Bar ‚Äì Adapt the look and feel of your search interface to match your brand identity 

Pair it with Intelligent Selling Services to unlock AI-powered search capabilities‚Äîdelivering personalized results, trending suggestions, and intent-driven recommendations that convert.  


Search Service

Streamlined Integrations for Pricing and Enhanced S/4 HANA-based Order Management  

Managing pricing and promotions just got easier! With the latest SAP S/4HANA integrations, SAP Commerce Cloud users can now handle product pricing and order value calculations accurately and consistently from one centralized location.

  • B2B Price Calculation ‚Äì SAP Variant Configuration and Pricing applies backend pricing rules while handling cart calculations independently, reducing system load. Define product models and pricing rules once and apply them universally
  • Omnichannel Promotions ‚Äì Leverage SAP Omnichannel Promotion Pricing to create multi-code coupons for targeted campaigns across SAP Customer Experience solutions like SAP Emarsys, delivering personalized offers that boost sales, loyalty, and brand awareness.  

 Order Management with SAP S/4HANA enhances visibility and saves time. 

  • With SAP S/4HANA order integration, attached documents like product specifications or special instructions, along with detailed status information from SAP S/4HANA document flow, are now visible directly in order history. Furthermore, synchronizing products from SAP S/4HANA to display in order history and order details is no longer required. Customers benefit from a comprehensive, 360-degree view of orders, including those not submitted through SAP Commerce Cloud and those containing products not listed in the SAP Commerce Cloud catalogue. 

New APIs Deliver Smarter Self-Service and Automation

We have introduced powerful APIs to simplify operations, reduce manual effort, and improve efficiency: 

  • Scaling Configuration API ‚Äì Automate sandbox scaling to save consumption credits and reduce errors. Retrieve current scaling, schedule environment actions like hibernation or wake-up, and enforce off-hours policies through scripts‚Äîgiving DevOps teams greater control
  • Cloud Portal API ‚Äì Manage dozens of endpoints effortlessly. Programmatically control configurations, including Maintenance Mode, and automate maintenance toggles across environments for faster, error-free operations
  • SSL Certificate Management API ‚Äì Eliminate manual certificate swaps with automated updates via API. Integrate with your CA/SCM for faster processes, fewer mistakes, lower outage risk, and scalable governance.  

Event Notifications Framework with Guaranteed Delivery 

Integrating with your preferred systems is easier than ever thanks to our configurable Event Notifications Framework. Choose from over 140 prebuilt events‚Äîincluding Order Placed, User Account Deleted, Product Reviewed, and more‚Äîcovering transactional, user, and backend activities. 

Set up real-time messaging to third-party systems using Webhooks in Backoffice, complete with a visual configurator that minimizes custom coding and maximizes flexibility. 

To ensure critical updates never get lost, we have introduced At-least-once delivery (ALOD). This feature automatically retries failed webhook transmissions, guaranteeing that essential events are delivered at least once and protecting your most important data.  


Webhook Events with At Least Once Delivery enabled 

Flexible Purchasing with B2B PunchOut for Composable Storefront 

B2B PunchOut gives buyers a smooth way to browse a supplier‚Äôs online catalog and transfer selected items directly into their procurement system as a requisition. The process includes automatic login and logout for a frictionless experience. 

With PunchOut integrated into the Composable Storefront, the shopping cart becomes the foundation for creating a purchase requisition. This requisition is then routed for internal approval within the buyer‚Äôs organization. Once approved, the order flows back to the supplier‚Äôs site for processing. There‚Äôs no traditional checkout button‚Äîinstead, when you‚Äôre ready, simply click ‚ÄúBack to Requisition‚Äù to finalize the transaction in your procurement system.  


Shopping cart page in PunchOut session‚ÄØ 

Unlock Data Quickly with SQL View Gateway  

SQL View Gateway gives customers self-service access to SAP Commerce Cloud data, making analytics, reporting, and integrations faster and more efficient‚Äîhelping you turn insights into smarter decisions. 

Our new real-time database replicas provide direct SQL access, so you can build dashboards, trigger internal workflows, feed data into lakes, and more‚Äîall without impacting your production environment

Cut Costs with Non-Production Environment Hibernation

Take control of your commerce operations by hibernating non-production environments whenever you don‚Äôt need them‚Äîsafely and without any risk of data loss or recovery issues. You can even schedule hibernations, for example, after finishing a performance test campaign. The result? Significant cost savings, smarter resource allocation, and stronger security and compliance.  

We rolled out a self-service option that lets you trigger hibernation directly from the Cloud Portal or via API‚Äîno need to involve SAP support. It‚Äôs a simple way to make your IT infrastructure more efficient, secure, and cost-effective. 

Seamless Omnichannel Transactions with SAP Order Management Services 

The Central Order Service in SAP Order Management Foundation lays the groundwork for true omnichannel experiences. It seamlessly connects online and offline transactions, enabling scenarios such as BORIS (Buy Online, Return in Store) and BISRO (Buy in Store, Return Online) for maximum flexibility. Businesses also gain a 360-degree view of customer purchase histories, driving deeper personalization and engagement. 

The rollout of API V3 significantly improves scalability and performance, ensuring SAP Order Management Foundation can meet the demands of modern commerce environments. 

The new Availability Push feature for SAP Order Management for Sourcing and Availability proactively delivers up-to-date stock information to external systems like web shops and marketplaces. This reduces order cancellations caused by outdated data. Updates can be tailored by channel, product, and frequency, sending only changes in stock levels for efficient communication. 

The Type Code feature in SAP Omnichannel Sales Transfer and Audit introduces robust validation for ERP type codes. Customers can configure acceptable codes, preventing invalid entries from being processed and halting transactions until corrections are made‚Äîensuring data integrity and compliance. 

Upskill Employees with WalkMe Adoption Platform  

With WalkMe Premium for SAP CX, users receive real-time, role-based guidance and automation within SAP CX solutions, such as SAP Commerce Cloud. The embedded training and contextual help simplify complex workflows, accelerates onboarding, and ensures consistent execution. Organizations improve user adoption and unlock more value in their SAP CX investment.  

Partner Solutions Driving Innovation 

Our expanding partner ecosystem on the SAP Store continues to strengthen SAP Commerce Cloud with powerful solution extensions.

Newstore brings a mobile-first, SAP-ready solution with pre-built integrations across SAP commerce offerings to deliver faster, smarter service in retail stores. Its intuitive associate app streamlines workflows, reduces hardware dependency, and seamlessly connects digital and in-store experiences. From store fulfillment to task management and personalized service, Newstore helps retailers optimize operations in high-touch environments.  


NewStore‚ÄØ 

Revers.io extends SAP Order Management Services to enhance returns and post-sales processes. This pre-composed solution simplifies returns, repairs, and product reuse, offering an integrated self-service experience. Automated workflows across the after-sales chain reduce lead times, cut reverse logistics costs, and ease customer service workloads‚Äîall while accelerating time-to-market. 

Looking Ahead: 2026 and Beyond 

The innovations we delivered in 2025 underscore SAP‚Äôs commitment to helping businesses stay ahead in a rapidly evolving landscape. As we move into 2026 and beyond, our priority remains clear: delivering solutions that create measurable value, scale effortlessly, and enable frictionless customer experiences.  

Together, we‚Äôre shaping the next chapter of commerce and consumer industries. 
Here‚Äôs to an exciting journey ahead and wishing you a joyful holiday season and a successful new year!  

Additional Resources 

  • Retail, fashion and vertical business in SAP S/4HANA Cloud public edition 2508 
  • Q1 2025 SAP Commerce Cloud recap 
  • Q2 2025 SAP Commerce Cloud recap 
  • Q3 2025 SAP Commerce Cloud recap 
  • Sign up for Q4 2025 SAP Commerce Cloud release recap webcast 
  • Replay SAP Commerce Cloud: Year in Review and 2026 Roadmap webcast 

 Please share your feedback in a comment and follow our SAP Commerce Cloud topic page to connect with the community!

entry.title: Re: A Wish for CLI-Based ABAP
entry.content:
What an interesting read.

From my viewpoint, started with SAP Logon like 11 years ago or so and quickly adopted eclipse ADT, eclipse still feels like a good middle ground and is currently my preferred IDE for backend developments simply because the terminal can become overwhelming quickly if not fully familiar with the commands (though that might just be a matter of getting used to it).

The decision to bring backend developments to VScode seems like a good idea for several reasons.
For me the most appealing thing in that is simply to have just one IDE for both backend and frontend developments (I remember a brief period where I was able to do backend, frontend, and native HANA developments all in eclipse).
Currently it is still a wait for ABAP in VScode, and it might take a while for it to catch up with eclipse ADT.
I am curious what it will bring, and if somehow any IDE can let AI act directly on the backend code it would be a big empowerment for efficiency (that is without downloading the whole system locally and then uploading again what changed,. that is where git might one day provide a workable solution).

For now I am sticking with eclipse for 98% of backend developments, the missing 2% is for things like webdynpro that are not workable in eclipse :D.

entry.title: Problem with Intercompany STO and posting TM costs / problem with accounting
entry.content:
Hello. 

I need some tips and tricks how to solve the issue. I created Intercompany STO for feed transport between Serbia and Slovenia. Incoterms is DAP. In this case suppling plant is Serbia, transport is paid by Serbia, but the problem starts when we create outbound delivery/Freight Orders/Freight settlement document. There is everything settled on Serbia, but when I want to check FSD using t-code WLFLTM2 - Overview Freight Cost Distribution, Purch. Org. is on Slovenia, Profit center is on Slovenia, but it must be on Serbia. I agree it's because of STO, but is there any chance to change some settings for it, because now accounting had a problem because that transport cost gone on Slovenia? Is this connected to funds maybe? 

These cost cannot be capitalised, also. 

I checked if this is linked to TM settings in SPRO - Settlement Management - Posting Engine - Basic settings for creation Setllement Management Documents, but I cannot find the error. 

Thank you all in advance.

entry.title: Re: Connecting SAP Data Warehouse Cloud OData API with PowerBI via a Blank Query
entry.content:
Thank you @gustavokath very informative and helpful post. If its helpful for fellow members, I was stuck at the "Generate Access and Refresh Tokens" step for a longer than needed time because postman kept on throwing invalid grant type error at me. Finally, I was able to get it to work. Below is what I configured in postman:

Method - Post

URL - Pick up the Token URL from "App Integration" page of Datasphere -> System -> Administration -> App Integration

Params:

1> Key- grant_type; value - authorization_code

2>Key - response_type; value - token

Authorization:

Auth Type: Basic Auth

username - Enter client ID here (I did not need to change | to %7C) and Password - Enter client secret here.

Headers:

I did not make any changes here

Body:

1> key - grant_type; Value - authorization_code

2>key - code; Value - provide the code that you generated in step 2."generate code grant token".

3> redirect_uri - https://oauth.powerbi.com/views/oauthredirect.html

That's it and then click on Send to receive the access_token, refresh_token etc.

entry.title: ZZ field upload in the journal entries app is not populated the backend
entry.content:
Dear all,

I am currently working on an SAP S/4HANA On-Premise implementation and I am facing an issue with a custom ZZ field in the Journal Entry upload process.

Context

  • I have a custom ZZ field created in the CI_COBL extension.

  • According to SAP notes, this field needs to be published so it can be used in the Upload Journal Entries Fiori app.

  • I exposed and published the field as a Key User Custom Field extension in the Coding Block using transaction SCFD_EUI.

  • The S_ATO_SETUP was already configured.

Configuration Done

The field has been published and activated in the following apps and objects:

  • Journal Entry Item

  • FINS Substitution / Validation ‚Äì Journal Entry Item

  • Manage Journal Entries

  • Post General Journal Entries

  • Target structure for field mapping

  • All OData and SOAP services related to FINS_CODING_BLOCK

Observed Behavior

  • The field is correctly published.

  • When I open the Upload Journal Entries app and download the Excel template, the custom field (ZZUEN) is present in the template.

  • However, when I fill the ZZUEN field in the template and upload it:

    • The journal entry is successfully posted.

    • The ZZUEN value is not populated in the corresponding ZZ field in ACDOCA.

Debugging and Analysis

  • I activated BADI_FINS_ACDOC_POSTING_EVENTS and implemented debugging logic to intercept the posting process.

  • The ZZ field exists in ACDOCA and is visible in the item structures passed to the BAdI methods.

  • However, the original frontend field (ZZ_1* field from the Excel / UI) is not available in the interface structures, so I cannot perform the mapping.

  • It seems the value is lost before reaching the posting BAdI.

Question

The process appears straightforward: expose the field via Custom Fields, activate it in the UI and services, and use it in the Upload Journal Entries app. While the field is technically available and visible in the template, it is not mapped to the backend ZZ field during posting.

  • Is there a specific BAdI or enhancement spot responsible for mapping custom fields from the XLSX layout to the backend coding block?

  • Is there any additional configuration required to ensure the custom field value is transferred from the Upload Journal Entries app to ACDOCA?

Any hints or guidance to resolve this issue would be highly appreciated.

Kind regards,
Francisco

entry.title: How Does HRIS Sync Handle Time Zones and Effective Dates for Global Users?
entry.content:
Hello Experts, 

We have only used Employee Central (EC) for users in the KST time zone so far.
However, we will soon be adding users in other time zones (e.g., the U.S., France, Mexico, and Australia).

As we introduce users in different time zones, we have a question regarding HRIS Sync. The HRIS Sync job is currently scheduled to run at 00:00 KST.

If the job runs based on KST (as shown in the table), we expect that for some countries the effective date may be treated as the previous day (i.e., processed one day earlier). We are concerned this could cause issues for processes such as hiring and termination. In particular, we suspect that terminations for users outside KST could be processed a day earlier and set users to Inactive prematurely.

We would appreciate your feedback on whether this assumption is correct.
If we are misunderstanding how HRIS Sync handles time zones and effective dates, please let us know.

KST2026-01-0100:00
UTC2025-12-3115:00
Paris2025-12-3116:00
London2025-12-3115:00
Mexico City2025-12-3109:00
AEST2026-01-0101:00


Thanks advance.

entry.title: Re: Project Cost Report does not display actual costs?
entry.content: The easiest way to report the actual costs posted in a project is to use the Profit and Loss - Actuals app. After retrieving the data, add Project and WBS Element to the rows of Dimensions in the Navigation Panel on the left side of the Report. There is no need to maintain separate financial statement versions, hierarchies, and semantic tags.

entry.title: Re: Bill of Material (BOM)
entry.content:
Hi Community,

 

"  

BOM can be single level and multi-level. For example, finished material would contain semi-finished materials as components which in turn would contain raw materials as components in next level.

Bill of Material having component number, description with quantity and unit measure.

There can be different alternative BOMs for a product depending upon the lot sizes, validity dates, and different production methods.

BOM is used in production planning for semi-finished and purchase planning for raw materials. "

 

Thanks for your selfless sharing, it really help us a lot.

 

üôÇ

 

Regards,

ZFiori.
